intro: Schkuhria pinnata var. octoaristata, commonly known as the eight-ribbed yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically arranged in a pinnate pattern, with multiple pairs of leaflets along each stem. Schkuhria pinnata var. octoaristata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
